segments.en: Linked Discourses 45
3. The Wrong Way
30. With Uttiya
At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā uttiyo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami … pe … ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā uttiyo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Uttiya went up to the Buddha … and asked him,

segments.pli: “idha mayhaṃ, bhante, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
segments.en: “Just now, sir, as I was in private retreat this thought came to mind.
‘The Buddha has spoken of the five kinds of sensual stimulation.

segments.pli: Katame nu kho pañca kāmaguṇā vuttā bhagavatā’”ti?
segments.en: What are they?’”
“Good, good, Uttiya!

segments.pli: Pañcime kho, uttiya, kāmaguṇā vuttā mayā.
segments.en: I have spoken of these five kinds of sensual stimulation.
What five?

segments.pli: Cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā,
segments.en: Sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.
Sounds known by the ear …
Smells known by the nose …
Tastes known by the tongue …

segments.pli: kāyaviññeyyā phoṭṭhabbā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā—
segments.en: Touches known by the body that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: ime kho, uttiya, pañca kāmaguṇā vuttā mayā.
segments.en: These are the five kinds of sensual stimulation that I’ve spoken of.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, uttiya, pañcannaṃ kāmaguṇānaṃ pahānāya ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo bhāvetabbo.
segments.en: The noble eightfold path should be developed to give up these five kinds of sensual stimulation.
What is the noble eightfold path?
It is right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, uttiya, pañcannaṃ kāmaguṇānaṃ pahānāya ayaṃ ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo bhāvetabbo”ti.
segments.en: This is the noble eightfold path that should be developed to give up these five kinds of sensual stimulation.”

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha taught the eightfold path in order to give up the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
